clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial of Acupuncture for Knee Osteoarthritis With Differential Functional Status of Acupoints

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators plan to undertake a rigorous multicentre randomised controlled trial, comparing acupuncture on sensitized acupoints versus non-sensitized acupoints, to test if acupuncture on sensitized acupoints may result in improved treatment outcomes in patients with Knee osteoarthritis (KOA).

detailed_description.textblock: All patients in the intervention group will receive acupuncture treatment on the most sensitive acupoints and all patients of the control group will receive acupuncture treatment on the least sensitive acupoints. Common practices and treatment period are similar with the intervention group.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Western Ontario and McMaster Universities Osteoarthritis index (WOMAC, VAS version) score at 16 week
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessments will be conducted at baseline and 16 weeks after randomization
